video.title: Python Django Framework Full Course - Learning with the Docs
video.description:
Learn the Python Django framework directly from the Django documentation. Django is a high-level Python Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

In this tutorial, we will build a full MVC app using the Django official docs as a guide.

⭐️Contents ⭐️
⌨️(0:00) Part 1
⌨️(25:09) Part 2
⌨️(1:06:49) Part 3
⌨️(1:45:25) Part 4
⌨️(2:26:33) Part 5
⌨️(3:18:00) Part 6

This tutorial was developed by the Clever Programmer. Check out the Clever Programmer YouTube channel for more great tutorials: https://www.youtube.com/c/CleverProgrammer

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: Jyoti Singh
topLevelComment.text:
Hello Sir, when I'm trying to run this "python manage.py runserver", I'm getting error: File "manage.py" , line 14
) from exc
        ^        
SyntaxError : invaild syntax

I tried all possible solution but nothing helped. Please help me out.

replies.author: Mathias
replies.text:
I'm a complete noob, so this is from beginner to beginner, but I get that error when I'm not in the correct directory or when I have forgot to exit the shell.
if the terminal line starts with ">>>" then you are in the shell, write "quit()" to exit.
to check if you are in the outer mysite directory, write "ls"
if you see mysite and manage.py next to it, you're in the correct one
if not, write "cd" to enter the folder that comes up until you're in the right one.
I haven't figured out how to go back a folder level yet so what I usually do if I have to go back is to just press ctrl+D and find my way in again

replies.author: Nishanth S
replies.text:
You would have forgotten to activate your virtual environment.
Use " pipenv shell " command to activate the virtual environment. Hope it helps
